website_summaries.verdict: Oster’s sizable 10-Cup Rice Cooker is extremely simple to use, holds plenty of rice, and sports a convenient auto heating setting so whatever is left over will be soft and fluffy when you come back for seconds.
pros: Removable inner nonstick pop is easily cleaned
Features carrying handles and locking lid
Includes steaming tray, measuring cup, and rice paddle
cons: A tempered glass lid would have been nice for checking in on how your meats and veggies are steaming

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rice every time
customer_reviews.text: I have a long history with rice cookers. I bought this one for a vacation house. It is so much better than my others! The nonstick coating seems very tough and rice does not stick. Perfect rice every time.
customer_reviews.author: Jane S.

customer_reviews.title: Not great rice
customer_reviews.text: Have used better rice cookers. I have used rice cookers for over 20 years, but this Rival leaves the rice a lot drier then any I have used before. Even if it add a bit more water, the bottom is ok, but the top is not. I purchased a smaller rice cooker for my son for college and the rice is perfect every time. I wouldn't purchase this again and I am most likely going to buy the smaller rice cooker that I got for him, Aroma 6-Cup Pot-Style Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: and not a good one at all
customer_reviews.text: Tried it many different times, different water ratios, and it makes a tadizh on the bottom every time, and not a good one at all. I don't know how all these people praise rice cookers like they're foolproof miracle machines. I make far better rice in any nonstick pan with a good enough surface. This seems to stay on cooking mode for too long and it turns the bottom layer of rice into tough plastic. It's also really really lightweight and that makes it feel cheap and that's just a downer. I don't want that when I'm cooking. I've got no use for this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Xenophon's loser brother

customer_reviews.title: The Rice Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I considered the complaints before buying this rice cooker, but we are really happy with it. One important note is that it is super simple - no setting options - and while some cooks like lots of settings, we like to flip the switch and go about our business. I am a repeat Rival customer (for rice cookers, anyway) and recommend this for no-fuss rice cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela M. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: a few extra items should have been noted
customer_reviews.text: easy to use, easy to clean, works quickly and without fuss! Especially like the glass lid. A nice, efficient product, well executed. However, when purchased, the length of the cord was not noted (needs to be 8" longer) and the position from which it exits the body of the cooker should have been specified. It comes out of the left side; I needed it to exit right.
customer_reviews.author: arztin

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: Have used it +20 times, simple, easy, effective. Just stir the rice every once in a while and don't let it sit dirty. Non stick is holding up nicely, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: andrew

customer_reviews.title: I've been using this for weeks now and just love the way it works
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for weeks now and just love the way it works! It makes good rice in about 15-min's time without any burnt parts at the bottom as mentioned in reviews of other brands. I also steam vegetables along the way and it's so convenient to make a quick and healthy meal. I am also using it to make soup. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: Cooks rice perfect, and fast! These 'external' rice cookers are also nice because the steam bucket sits on top of the rice cooker, and not inside - Enclosed rice cookers have an internal basket that intrudes on the main chamber, and because they sit inside they have to handle (Very hot to handle). If you're have trouble with this thing being messy, that's because you're not washing your rice. Starch is forming from rice dust, which forms bubbles that get into the exhaust, pop, and throw mess everywhere. Rinse your rice 3-6 time in cold water before cooking to fix (Just put the rice in a bowl, fill it with water, swish around a bit gently, drain, and repeat).
customer_reviews.author: Tanner Brian Wetzel

customer_reviews.title: This rice cooker gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: So far this rice cooker has worked very well. It cooks up to 5 cups of uncooked rice. I haven't really timed it yet, but it seems to cook fairly quickly. I like that it has a non-stick coating which makes cleaning the pot easier too. The keep warm light is illuminated to remind you that the rice is done and is on the keep warm setting. Overall, I like this rice cooker and would recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: localgirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these types of rice cookers. They are idiot-proof and make great rice and other grains. I don't really feel the need for fancy functions so these are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: MargoPsu55

customer_reviews.title: Truthfully perfect rice every time
customer_reviews.text: Truthfully perfect rice every time, fast, easy to clean, great price for this product. Much better than having to wait for a pot of water heat up on the stove. Pick up a kilo size bag of rice and you're set. PS: steamer works well, but if you're making a large quantity it'd be best to purchase a separate one. The juices can drip which isn't really a problem, but may be to some.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Need to stir regularly
customer_reviews.text: I like the way the rice is cooked using this cooker. But the only annoying thing is that you have to regularly stir the rice otherwise it will stick at the bottom of the cooker and slightly burn. In addition, you will have to leave the lid open a bit to let the stream out otherwise it will turn a bit messy all over.
customer_reviews.author: Wattakorn

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A TRUE 10 CUP RICE POT
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wanted a 10 cup rice pot, she has a 3 cup. This pot is actually a bit larger than her 3 cup... I have to say I’m disappointed with Rival, one could always count on their products.
customer_reviews.author: pengochay

customer_reviews.title: 5 years worked perfectly for family of 5
customer_reviews.text: I've had this rice cooker for almost 5 years. We are a family of 5 and it has worked perfectly for us, until this past month it wasn't cooking right and leaving the rice hard. That being said, after reading many reviews on other rice cookers, 5 years is a good life span. It never spit liquid or was a messy clean up. Super easy to use even for my kids that started using it at 8 yrs old. I taught them to wash the rice (we use calrose) and measure the water with the Filipino finger!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Pot is no good.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 5 mo. ago & saw the rice pot had a black chalky outside. I thought it would clean off. Wrong! It is awful and makes my hands black every time I use it- which is often. Never had one like this before. I've used many brands over the years- we eat a lot of rice & usually the outside is silver metal. This is ? black residue that doesn't wash off. Also is very rinky- dink - poorly made & not very sturdy. Don't waste your money - mine is going in the trash!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Lee Greene

customer_reviews.title: Makes a mess!
customer_reviews.text: First time buying a rice cooker. Followed the instructions exactly, but every time I used it I had water spewing out of the vent hole in the lid. It made a mess all over my counters. The rice on the bottom was slightly burnt every time, also. I tried changing up the amount of water used (a little less, a little more), but always ended up with a mess on my counters. Would most definitely NOT recommend this product. Returning it today to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Budget friendly and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a large family. Easy to use and clean. Cooks rice evenly. Glass lid stays put during boiling phase without spilling hot starchy rice water all over the cooker. Only downside is the electrical cord is attached to the cooker, but that is a minor inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Lori F.

customer_reviews.title: Easy rice
customer_reviews.text: This makes perfect rice every time...but you do have to follow the instructions...
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Just follow the instructions
customer_reviews.text: We love this rice cooker. It gets the job done and if you go by the measurements in the cooking container your rice comes out perfect every time.
customer_reviews.author: LAC RN

customer_reviews.title: Not new, has dents and wont stay on cook
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker looks used. The box is all taped up, a part of the under part of the lid is damaged, one of the steamer tray handles are loose and bent and the cooker button won't stay pushed down. I have no idea how good it works as I'm sending this mess back.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: worst rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I used this rice cooker 2 times and both times it overflowed spewing all over counter and floor. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: jas hall

customer_reviews.title: Fraudulent advertising!!
customer_reviews.text: This is falsely advertised as a 10 cup (cooked) or 5 cups uncooked. However, that is only if you use the included "rice cooker cup" which is, in fact, only 3/4 of a cup! Check out the attached photo. Just unpacked it and read the instructions. This thing will be lucky to make 5 real cups of cooked rice.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mailler, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: It works like any other rice cooker, it's nothing fancy. I would recommend this buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a rice cooker at the store and returned it within days. I will NOT be returning this. It's fabulous! It is SO easy to clean too besides making perfect rice every time.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: lol All I know is it is a GREAT product and definitely recommend it
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I needed one of these until my son showed me the miracles that one produces. Can make just rice or whole meals. Who knew!!! lol All I know is it is a GREAT product and definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: NC Lady

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate makes the rice in record time and you can steam steam vegetables at the same time love it
customer_reviews.author: Kym King

customer_reviews.title: Great rice maker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend. He loves it and now can make his own rice 😁
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: I like having a rice cooker more than I thought I would
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! I never thought I would use a rice cooker until my daughter purchased one and I used that one. They are so nice to cook perfect rice with! And with the steamer basket I can throw vegetables on top and have the side dishes cooked perfectly! :) Anyway, this rice cooker works very well, and the medium size makes a great amount of rice.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Spews starchy water all over
customer_reviews.text: Spews starchy water all over the counter! The non-stick pot worked fine and the rice was cooked well. But I can't make more than 2 cups of rice without the water bubbling up and spraying out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Albert

customer_reviews.title: Loved this rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: Loved this rice cooker. It cooks the rice evenly and thoroughly. I ordered one for my mom too. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrie P.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, I got it because my smaller one wouldn't cook a large batch of rice. This one does 2 cups uncooked really fast. Less than 30 minutes. And cleanup is easy.
customer_reviews.author: philip lamontagne

customer_reviews.title: Good buy and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: Good buy. I had a Rival before but I gave it to my son. We ordered this new one and it works great! Cooks the rice perfectly and easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Susan MY

customer_reviews.title: Affordable & Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: The only thing i dislike is that I have to put a little bit more water in then suggested because I find out that it will stick to the bottom. However it is easy to clean. I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cleo S

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: Makes a lot of rice at one time. No complaints so far..im happy with quality for the price..perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Finally! Rice and veggies ready all at once! ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally! Rice and veggies ready all at once! Just add a protein and dinner is complete! This is a must-have while our kitchen is being repaired. Plan ahead, though, as the combo of two cups rice plus a tray of veggies takes 40 minutes to cook. Still...prep time is minimal, so while we are eating out of our living room and garage fridge, this simplifies things immensely! We're practically glamping!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Marks

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is easy to use, easy to clean, doesn't burn the rice, and is just the right size. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: SVac

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: A good little investment. It's easy to clean and also steams vegetables. Can't beat the price nor the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Robinson

customer_reviews.title: My last Rival lasted 20yrs
customer_reviews.text: I used it about 3 days per week, LOVE RIVAL!
customer_reviews.author: Chihuahua Moms

customer_reviews.title: Great rice pot!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this rice pot! I use it all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Louisiana Girl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Its great quailty and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Marie A. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter in college and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Very useful cooker
customer_reviews.text: It is very useful rice cooker for small family Very convenient and comfortable. Best use is my kids can cook in this Happy to use it
customer_reviews.author: Zeba khan

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Jasmine rice comes out a little wet, but the convenience of not having to mess with other cooking methods makes it worthwhile. If I had paid a higher price, I might not be as forgiving. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Red Boat Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer
customer_reviews.text: I use this steamer to steam fish, chicken or vegetables. I prefer the basket because a small bowl can fit inside. Easy to clean. I wish it had a switch to power the cooker on and off instead of plug or unplug. This can be solved by purchasing an inline plug switch that the cooker can plug into.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M.

customer_reviews.title: Quick Cooking Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: Simple rice cooker. Very light so easy to bring to trips. It cooks pretty quick too.
customer_reviews.author: Lah

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older model rice cooker I had for years! Love this one, even great for steaming veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for a cheap cooker.
customer_reviews.text: Don't trust the auto-shutoff. It will overcook and scorch the bottom of your rice.
customer_reviews.author: Majest1c

customer_reviews.title: Garbage quality.
customer_reviews.text: Just over four months from purchase, and it stopped working. Bought this to replace a cheap Proctor Silex rice cooker that lasted 11 years. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Vladimir Slobikitnikoff

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the size is just for a small family. no mess when cooking
customer_reviews.author: hy

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Can't live without it. Had one that was used at least once a week for a couple years, and it finally stopped working. This is a replacement and going strong. Great for rice and grains - and for steaming veggies. Excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: JJ on the Cape

customer_reviews.title: Very small for 10 cups rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rice cooker in May and I just notice said 10 cups but rice cooker was 5 -cup rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Noriko A Forbes

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Use it everyday. I always use Rival for cooking rice. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful addition to my kitchen small appliances!
customer_reviews.text: I had a similar one that I used for years so bought the same type again since I was so happy with the previous one. Well worth the price, great product and easy to use. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace our smaller rice cooker that died. Love it! Fast cooking, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: Best rice cooker I've owned!
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this rice cooker so far. Thank you so much for saving me from a life of stove rice cooking lol. This product has been a life saver for me. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Better than other branded ones
customer_reviews.text: Far better than other branded one...works perfectly fine, with minimal spill was water while cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Sunita P

customer_reviews.title: Works as good as the old one and hopefully will last as ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Rival Rice Cooker I've had for years that finally died. Works as good as the old one and hopefully will last as long.
customer_reviews.author: miked

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Rice Every Time!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I purchased. One for each home. Perfect rice every time!
customer_reviews.author: Sapphire Ed

customer_reviews.title: Rice burnt in bottom. No use of purchase , waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I brought this rice cooker for easy cooking. But pathetic, rice burnt in bottom forming a plastic layer, I do not suggest to buy this product. It is taking 45 mins to prepare 2 cups of rice.
customer_reviews.author: Anand

customer_reviews.title: asian without a rice cooker is like having french fries without ketchup
customer_reviews.text: asian without a rice cooker is like having french fries without ketchup! now i have perfectly cook rice everyday! wifey can't be happier
customer_reviews.author: wackydude5

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I needed a rice cooker but use it often. Great for grits and polenta. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: JBH SC

customer_reviews.title: The best rice cooker ever
customer_reviews.text: The best product I have purchased from amazon. I do everything in the rice cooker even though is just meant to cook rice. I love it, 100 percent recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Zully

customer_reviews.title: Easily breaks
customer_reviews.text: It broke right away, keeps going on “Keep warm” after 5 min.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Not 10 cups!!!
customer_reviews.text: What you need to know is that when they say "10 cups", they are not referring to standard, 8 ounce cups. The cooker comes with a little plastic scooper and those are the cups they are talking about. Otherwise, I am happy with this thing. It functions just fine and the build quality is on par with my beloved Rival CrockPot.
customer_reviews.author: lance

customer_reviews.title: Same model: Old one worked for 6 years and new one broke in a month
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a same one for 6+ years. It's still working fine (yes, it does make a mess on the countertop when cooking, but the rice tastes good) but the interior of the inner bowl is heavily scratched due to natural wear. So I decided to order the same one to simply get a new bowl. The new one stopped working just a month after purchase - the button would not stay down to allow cooking. Wonder if we just had good luck with the first one or bad luck with the second one.
customer_reviews.author: Hundred Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I'm in college, living in a dorm room & this rice cooker is very convenient. I've had this for about 5 months, and it works great for rice, quinoa, oatmeal, and pasta sauces (that's what I've used it for so far). No problems during cooking at all!
customer_reviews.author: DetectiveCookie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works good, replacing one that we had before, same one, lasted a long time, would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jerry G.Odom

customer_reviews.title: The taste is great!
customer_reviews.text: Rice came out tasting so good & also cooked so fast! I recommend buying this .
customer_reviews.author: Denise A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2 to 4 servings!
customer_reviews.text: Our daugther-in-law and son love this rice cooker. We have one that is a little larger, but this is just for the two of them, so it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Buick

customer_reviews.title: It works very well, but was a lot smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well, but was a lot smaller than what I needed. My 10 cups and their 10 cups differ greatly. However, as I said before, it works very well when taking my BBQ meatballs to parties or cooking my flan (had to improvise a little and add a little cast iron trivet I owned otherwise lid would not have closed with the steamer that accompanied the cooker.)
customer_reviews.author: MagS

customer_reviews.title: It is great. Love cooking with it
customer_reviews.text: It is great. Love cooking with it. No problems at all
customer_reviews.author: DORIS

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace one that was left on the stove top by mistake and partly melted. New one is even better than the older version
customer_reviews.author: Josie P. Little

customer_reviews.title: Fire risk.
customer_reviews.text: Filled house with smell of burning plastic. Fear of fire.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Fillebrown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Rice!
customer_reviews.text: This is about my 3rd rice cooker. Cooks rice perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. My rice comes out nice and fluffy, also it don't take to much space on the counters. I highly recommend it as it is a great item such a small price. Laura.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Rival Rice Cooker w/Steam basket
customer_reviews.text: My Hitachi rice and steamer seemed better than this one - deeper steam basket and seemed better made - it's ok
customer_reviews.author: Greyhound Gal

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this rice cooker.... This is the second I have purchased. It works just like they say it will!!
customer_reviews.author: Bearey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, It Just arrived and did a yellow rice, everything is right.
customer_reviews.author: Ram

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Fast clean up. Like the steam vegetable side.
customer_reviews.author: Deenie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Cooks evenly
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Cooks evenly, with no spills, burning, browning, or sticking. Assuming it keeps working, I am very satisfied with the performance of our new rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy For Its Price!
customer_reviews.text: I find it reliable - easy to use - unobtrusive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Acosta

customer_reviews.title: Turned out to be a great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this rice cooker as a gift to a friend. She loves it! She tells me that she uses it about 3 times a week. Turned out to be a great gift!!
customer_reviews.author: pb.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I knew how many cups this cooker would make before I ordered it, so it's my fault that this is smaller than I expected. I was replacing a Cuisinart rice cooker that works well, but is just too small. I like to have leftover rice for lunches, etc, so I'll have to use both cookers to get enough.
customer_reviews.author: Eve StarrTop Contributor: Crochet

customer_reviews.title: Great Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love this rice cooker. Easy to use and easy to clean. I would give it 5 stars, but if I am not right there to tend to the rice when it goes in to the warm mode it will burn to the bottom of the rice cooker quickly. Stirring the rice is key to keeping it form burning.
customer_reviews.author: Christina S.

customer_reviews.title: The brown rice turned out like porridge, it was really ugly
customer_reviews.text: I am please with my rice cooker but not please with the instructions on cooking brown rice from the package of brown rice! So I guess I will even have to learn how to cook rice! The brown rice turned out like porridge, it was really ugly! My mother-in-law laughed when she saw it and said I had too much water vs rice. The rice cooker does bubble out water vapor when it is cooking so that is a bit of a problem for clean up, that is the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars! I will be trying my rice cooking again this week so wish me luck!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Douglas Holmes

customer_reviews.title: It is not a 10-cup rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: It can cook only 3 cups of rice. This will translate to 6-cups of cooked rice. I don't know how they calculated this to be 10-cup rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Pal

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Have used 2 of these but each last only about 1 year.
customer_reviews.author: Nirvana

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed ;(
customer_reviews.text: OK, it cooks rice as all the comments have said, which is why I chose it. HOWEVER, the teflon starts to chip almost immediately and I do not use metal in it. I would return it but its over the time limit. I cannot believe no one else has had this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mina Parlin Seegers

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this rice cooker because my old 10 cup ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this rice cooker because my old 10 cup (cooked rice) cooker had gotten damaged. When it arrived, I was shocked to see that it was half the size of my old one. Not wanting to make a sight judgment, I put 5 cups of uncooked rice into the pot. The rice took up at least 2/3 of the container! 10 cups of water would NOT have fit into the pot with the rice! I cannot judge how well it actually cooks rice because I immediately packaged it back up for return. I have a large family and I needed the real 10 cup capacity.
customer_reviews.author: J Stinson

customer_reviews.title: Works, but can be messy
customer_reviews.text: It works about as well as the other rice cookers I've owned. The power cord is built in and cannot be removed, so it's a little awkward to store in the cupboard with that cord hanging out. My other rice cookers had removable power cords. Update: Reduced to 3 stars from 5: When cooking 3 scoops or more, the starchy bubbles spatter out of the vent hole making a big mess. My other rice cookers didn't do that. Some people have said that washing the rice reduces the starch mess, but I've also heard that washing the rice also reduces the nutrition content.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth it, I promise.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a stream of rice cookers, and I prefer the one button kind. Just received this today and it’s the best one I’ve ever had. Rinse your rice well and there won’t be a drop of mess. I made 4 cups of basmati rice (use the cup that comes with it, they give it to you for a reason) and it came out perfect. It looks small, but it’s as big as you need. I’ve had bigger cookers and it was just wasted space, I promise. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: mommy blue

customer_reviews.title: STICKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Rival Rice Cooker for over 20 years. Mine finally went out and I purchased this one as Wal-Mart was always out. I am so disappointed in this cooker. For starters, there is no 'bing - ring' sound when the rice is complete. The rice seems as though it is still cooking and it gets literally burnt on the bottom of the bowl. It is hard and like old rice when you get towards the bottom even when you stir the rice prior to serving. I am not at all happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: C. Napier

customer_reviews.title: ... shut off doesn’t work for us for how we like rice but after a couple of attempts we now ...
customer_reviews.text: Auto shut off doesn’t work for us for how we like rice but after a couple of attempts we now have it down to a fine art and always end up with perfect rice. Tip. We always add a bit of butter to the water before we start it and stirring it every 5 minutes as it stops us getting that crispy layer at the bottom we personally don’t like.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Garrett

customer_reviews.title: but am pleased to see it came with a steaming basket for ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrive quickly and packaged well. I intend to use this item to cook brown rice specifically, but am pleased to see it came with a steaming basket for vegetables, etc. After the first attempt to cook brown rice, I'm reporting the Rival worked as indicated by the seller. The rice was cooked well, i.e. not partially cooked, or a soggy mass. I think I need to adjust the amount of water I add to the mix, but this is not a complaint.
customer_reviews.author: DLG-11

customer_reviews.title: This is the Best Rice Cooker Around. Durable. Lasting. Great Rice. Easy Clean.
customer_reviews.text: I had my other Rival 10-Cup Rice Cooker for about 17 years. It finally broke and probably because we had a power surge and not due to the cooker itself. This little guy lasts forever and cooks rice in about 15 minutes or less to perfection. It has gotten banged up, fallen off the counter, stuffed into suitcases, and taken with me while I travel often. I like that I can cook some rice and if I don't use it all, I can just take the container and lid and stuff it in the fridge for tomorrow. Great rice for the next day. This is the best rice cooker out there!
customer_reviews.author: Incognito

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: It works exactly as it should. I bought this to replace another just like it. Just wanted something to make rice and nothing else. It's nice to be able to set it up, leave it, do something else, and not to have to worry about a pot in need of constant watching.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbblesblue

customer_reviews.title: Still experimenting with the water ratios.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older oval Rival rice steamer that is finally breaking down so I replaced it with another Rival that was by far the least costly for the product functionality. I'm cooking UB's converted rice in this unit and I can't get away from getting toasted patches around the outside surfaces when it's completed. It's not burned but lightly browned. Will adding more water eliminate this issue? There are no settings to regulate the heat, so that's the only option I can think of that might rectify this issue with my unit. Any comments are welcome.
customer_reviews.author: MA Pobjecky

customer_reviews.title: An "okay" cooker
customer_reviews.text: I have used two of these, but I can't stick with them any longer. They cook just fine and can make enough for several people at once, but the non-stick coating is the problem--it's just not durable. After a while (a year or longer), the coating will begin wearing out and you will see metallic spots showing up even if you are careful to clean it with just paper towels and soft materials that won't scratch the surface.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thames

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is enough to cook for 5 cups of uncooked rice. It's the smallest rice cooker I have owned, but it gets the job done. The only thing, I don't like is I can not put the inner pot in the dishwasher. My son who was doing dishes didn't remember that as a result, the silver coating on the outside of the inner pot was discolored. Nevertheless, it does not affect the function of this rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: X. Hsu

customer_reviews.title: It spews starchy boiling rice water on my counter every time I make rice.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first rice cooker. I wanted to see the difference between cooking rice in a pot or this thing. Time to cook was equal, the only difference is that the rice cooker spews starchy boiling rice water on my counter every time I make rice, the pot does not. I consider this a wasted exercise in curiosity.
customer_reviews.author: Eli M

product_meta.title: Rival 10-Cup Rice Cooker with Steamer Basket, White/Black (RC101, 10-cup cooked rice capacity)
product_meta.description:
Easily prepare a complete, healthy, and fat-free meal with the Rival 10-Cup Rice Cooker with Steamer Basket. This electric rice cooker features a removable nonstick inner pot that has a 10-cup cooked rice capacity and a steaming basket that holds enough vegetables or shrimp for two or three hungry people. Simple to operate, the rice pot features just one switch and two settings to cook rice and keep it warm at the ideal serving temperature. A domed tempered glass lid retains moisture and nutrients while allowing you to monitor your food as it cooks. The stay-cool side loop handles make serving easy and effortless, and the power indicator lights let you know when the cycle is complete. This rice maker includes a measuring cup and a rice ladle. The Rival 10-Cup Rice Cooker measures 12 by 11-1/2 by 9-1/2 inches and comes with a one-year limited warranty.

AMAZON.COM
A complete, healthy, fat-free meal can easily be prepared in this electric rice cooker. The nonstick removable inner pot produces up to 10 cups of cooked rice, while the steaming basket holds enough vegetables or shrimp for two or three hungry people. Simple to operate, the cooker features just one switch and two settings, cook and keep warm. During cooking, a red light is illuminated; when cooking is complete, the switch automatically reverts to the keep-warm setting and a yellow light comes on. Moisture and nutrients are sent back into the cooker by the domed glass lid, which also allows for easy viewing. 

 After cooking, the rice should be allowed to sit for about ten minutes before the lid is removed. Included with the cooker is a plastic paddle for stirring and serving the rice, as well as a plastic measuring cup. The cup, paddle, pot, and steamer all should be washed by hand in hot, soapy water after each use. The rice cooker, including the stay-cool side loop handles, measures 12 by 11-1/2 by 9-1/2 inches and carries a one-year limited warranty. --Ann Bieri
feature_bullets: Electric rice cooker with nonstick inner pot has 10 cups cooked rice capacity (5 cups uncooked)
Steaming basket for shrimp or vegetables
Domed glass lid retains moisture and nutrients
Stay-cool side handles make serving easy
Hand washable measuring cup and rice ladle included
